news_header: Sexually transmitted infections (STIs) are rising in Europe, with gonorrhea cases reaching a record high of nearly 100,000 in 2023, up from 74,000 in 2022. Syphilis cases also increased by 13% to over 40,000.
news_original_title: STIs in Europe: Gonorrhea and syphilis hit record highs
news_text: Chlamydia remains the most common STI. Experts attribute the rise to decreased condom use, particularly among young people, and improved testing and reporting. Men who have sex with men are the most affected group. There is a call for better sexual health education and destigmatization of STIs.
